page.title: 01Llanrhian
page.content: The area is predominantely agricultural with the accent on milk and mutton production. Llanrhian is the central vllae of the area with a small population and a flourishing church. North Pembbrokeshire is popular with summer tourists and Porthgain is the tourist honey pot. This is an old port once used for the export of slate and roadstone. The disused workings have a grim charm and the sheltered harbour is popular with local fishers and sumer yachties The rugged coastline attracts walkers and the Pemrokeshire coast path takes them past a mill and the disused road stonequaries west of porthgain
